title: SQLAND Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLAND Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
AND
The
AND
command is used with WHERE to only include rows where both conditions is true.
The following SQL statement selects all fields from "Customers" where country is "Germany" AND city is "Berlin":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE Country='Germany'
 AND City='Berlin';

Reference

❯
★
+1

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of where country is '"Germany" AND city is "Berlin":
Example

WHERE Country='Germany'
 AND City='Berlin';

summary: This tutorial covers SQLAND Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLAND Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLAND Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
